name: Sample Player (Clocked)
description: This algorithm plays samples synced to a clock input or MIDI. It stretches or shrinks the sample to fit the tempo and time signature provided by the clock, making it ideal for rhythmic synchronization. The algorithm calculates the optimal number of bars based on the sample length and adjusts playback speed accordingly. It also includes features like auto-triggering in loops and manual triggering options via bus, MIDI, or manually.
short_description: Plays samples synced to a clock
gui_description: The display shows the waveform of the sample, updated during playback. Unlike other Sample Players, it visualizes the calculated loop length rather than the full sample duration. Tick marks indicate bars and beats above the waveform. To the right, it displays the sample length (seconds), natural bar count at original speed, and adjusted bar count for sync.

input_ports.name: Clock input
input_ports.description: Bus used as the clock signal source for synchronization.

input_ports.name: Reset input
input_ports.description: Bus used to trigger a reset on the sample playback (either as a trigger or run/stop mode).
